original_title: Sri Lanka bond market quiet ahead of bond auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields remained unchanged at open on Monday ahead of a treasury bond auction, while the interbank guidance peg was steady.
“The market is dull as investors are busy with the auction” a dealer said.

15,000 million rupees worth of Treasury Bonds under the series of 22.50 percent 2025’A’ and 20,000 million rupees worth of Treasury Bonds under the series of 20.00 percent 2027 ‘A’ are to be issued through the auction.
A bond maturing on 01.02.2025 last closed at 32.10/40 percent on Friday.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 last closed at 29.50/80 percent on Friday.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 last closed at 29.15/40 percent on Friday.
The Central Bank’s guidance peg for interbank US dollar transactions appreciated by 17 cent to 362.50 rupees from 362.67 against the US dollar. (Colombo/Feb 27/2023)
